intro: Doliocarpus ptariensis, commonly known as the Andean wax tree, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango trees. The plant is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves that help it conserve water in its high-altitude environment. Its small, yellow flowers are followed by red, fleshy fruits that are edible and often consumed by local wildlife. Doliocarpus ptariensis plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various species.
